intro: Agalinis longifolia, commonly known as the slender bluemouth, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom during the summer months. Agalinis longifolia is often found in sandy or loamy soils and is adapted to full sun conditions.
